content: In bullet point format, list down ten classical literature pieces from various parts of the world, including Europe, Asia, Africa, and South America. Beside each piece, write a one-sentence summary and the author's name.

1. **"The Odyssey" by Homer (Ancient Greece)** - An epic poem recounting Odysseus's ten-year journey home after the Trojan War, facing numerous challenges and temptations.

2. **"One Hundred Years of Solitude" by Gabriel García Márquez (Colombia)** - A magical realist novel chronicling seven generations of the Buendía family and their isolated town of Macondo.

3. **"Things Fall Apart" by Chinua Achebe (Nigeria)** - A story about Okonkwo, a wealthy and influential Igbo leader, and his struggle with change and identity in the face of British colonialism.

4. **"Don Quixote" by Miguel de Cervantes (Spain)** - A satirical novel about an aging nobleman who becomes obsessed with chivalric romances and sets out to revive chivalry, aided by his squire Sancho Panza.

5. **"The Tale of Genji" by Murasaki Shikibu (Japan)** - Often considered the world's first novel, it depicts the life and romantic entanglements of Hikaru Genji, a courtier in Heian-era Japan.

6. **"War and Peace" by Leo Tolstoy (Russia)** - An epic novel that explores the history and philosophy of Russia through the lives of five families during the Napoleonic era.

7. **"The Canterbury Tales" by Geoffrey Chaucer (England)** - A collection of stories told by a group of pilgrims traveling from London to Canterbury Cathedral, offering insights into medieval English society.

8. **"Gilgamesh" (Ancient Sumer)** - One of the earliest known works of literature, detailing the adventures of King Gilgamesh and his quest for immortality following the death of his friend Enkidu.

9. **"The Iliad" by Homer (Ancient Greece)** - An epic poem focusing on the rage of Achilles and the events during the Trojan War, providing a glimpse into ancient Greek heroic ideals.

10. **"Dream of the Red Chamber" by Cao Xueqin (China)** - A complex novel that delves into the rise and fall of the noble Rongguo family, exploring themes of love, politics, and societal decay in imperial China.
